Welcome !

We focus on actively investing large scale entertainment, leisure, hospitality, medium to large scale real estate, renewable energy, and other strategic projects across Ghana.

Overview

Company Overview

    Our Strategy

    Entertainment

    We focus on actively investing large scale entertainment, leisure, hospitality, medium to large scale real estate, renewable energy, and other strategic projects across Ghana

    Financial

    Spartan Ives aims to create financial value by directly investing equity into our portfolio companies or debt in partnership with investment partners around the world using patient capital as well restructuring operations of the invested assets to extract value

    Hospitality

    Ghana’s hospitality space is under-served by traditional financial institutions and Spartan Ives’ strategy is to fill this gap. Our most compelling reason is the impact our investments have on the wellbeing of our planet and how economic development can work hand in hand with sustaining the environment

    Our Projects

    Our Active Projects :

    Active Projects

    Polo Beach Club

    The Polo Beach Club (PBC) created in 2019 was a concept designed to create a social club making full use of Labadi Beach but also was designed to create a Segway into the Labadi Beach hotel asset in order to test the potential for profit within the area.

    The Club allowed both the Spartan and Labadi hotel team to to work together on basic silos of business including beverages, food and accommodation - the basic revenue lines of any hotel.

    The Project has been very successful leading to discussions on the full acqusition of the hotel and subsequently the entire beach.

    Active Projects

    Sunpower Innovations

    SunPower Innovations Ltd is the leading renewable energy EPC (Engineering, Procurement and Construction) company in Ghana.

    Licensed by the Energy Commission of Ghana, Sunpower Innovations provides reliable and affordable off-grid, grid-tied and hybrid systems for homes, businesses and government agencies.

    Its systems are fine tuned to the environmental parameters of sub-saharan Africa. In short, they POWER AFRICA the renewable way.

    Active Projects

    Accra Horse Race Track

    Spartan Ives together with Ghana’s horse racing association and Accra Turf Club are investing an African thoroughbred horse racing and equestrian entertainment centre. The first of its kind in Sub-saharan Africa.

    We are leveraging on our high end event organising background and our love for horses.The location will include an elegant afrocentric and eco-focused architectural structure nestled in a wooden setting

    Our site currently features a one-mile green racetrack & 7/8 mile turf track, stables, paddocks, event grounds and enough space for public horse rides We will hold annual horse racing events with an online gaming sports betting platform with recreational and entertainment facilities

    Active Projects

    Ghana Commercial Bank HQ

    We advanced a debt note to Sunpower to install a proof of concept for the full solarisation of all 250 Ghana Commercial Bank branches across the country.. Pilot Phase for 4 Branches (Head office, Legon, Derby Avenue & T.I/A).

    The model seeks to manage the energy infrastructure for the bank through solar hybridisation with existing energy modes (ECG & Generator).

    Two branches (Legon and TIA) 1.5MWp with 2MWH battery respectively and Derby Avenue 40KWp with Storage needs commissioned by the end of 2021. Typical savings of 35% on energy expenditure annually for the bank.

    Future Project:

    Acquisition and renovation of SNNIT Hotels

    Project Icarus

    Acquisition and renovation of SNNIT Hotels

    SNNIT: Ghana’s largest non-banking financial institution and National Social Securities Scheme holds one of the largest diversified portfolio of property investments in Ghana.

    The Project has been very successful leading to discussions on the full acqusition of the hotel and subsequently the entire beach. Moving towards its permanent structure, Spartan Ives is committed to reducing The Polo Beach Club’s carbon footprint investing in a more energy efficient building structure

    With the acquisition of these hotels, it will allow us to build proper infrastructure within the hotels and more importantly Labadi beach.

    Target Projects 2011 to 2030
